Description: Rugged mountains meet chilling sea.  Wildlife and majestic scenery are everywhere.
Name: Alaska

Description: Subtropical islands filled with sand, sea, and volcanic mountains.  Sea life and sun with a laid back vibe.
Name: Hawaii

Description: Tall mountains and high lakes.  Unbeatable scenery and cool fresh air.
Name: Rocky Mountains
Big Basin area with local attractions
Mesa Verde National Park, Colorado - ancient cliff houses

Description: Revisit our favorite parts of the Big Island.
Name: Big Island (Hawaii)

Description: Stay at the Hyatt, Westin, Hilton, or Outrigger resorts with nice pools. Some on the beach, some in Princeville above the beach. Activities include: Boat trip Na Pali Coastline with snorkeling or a dinner cruise, Waimea Canyon, Hanalei Bay, Trails, Waterfalls, river float, National Botanical Garden, Kilauea Lighthouse (and bird preserve), and cute towns on the beach.
Name: Kauai

Description: Revisit our favorite parts of Maui with optional day trip to Lanai, snorkeling, Haleakala, goat farm, beaches, etc.  We could stay at a resort with a big kid friendly pool or at one of Mom and Dad’s places.
Name: Maui

Description: Stay in the Glacier Park Lodge, pristine forests, alpine meadows, rugged mountains, and spectacular lakes.  Take the train here from Portland or Seattle, fly back to from Oakland.
Name: Glacier National Park

Description: Fly to Anchorage or Seward and enjoy the national parks up there.  These include (pick one)  Denali, Kenai Fjords, Katmai or Kodiak
Name: Alaska Land

Description: Museums, Monuments, Government
Name: Washington DC

Description: Beach, Monterey Aquarium, Santa Cruz Redwoods, Roaring Camp Railroad
Name: Monterey or Big Sur

Description: National park and looks beautiful.  American Virgin Island
Name: St Johns (Caribbean Island)

Description: 6 million acres, one road, shuttle bus only. All visitors to Denali wishing to venture past Mile 15 into the heart of the park must ride a bus to Toklat River, Eielson Visitor Center, Wonder Lake, or Kantishna
Name: Denali National Park

Description: Fly to Kodiak Island from Anchorage by float plane to stay in all inclusive wilderness cabin.  Alternatively, we can stay on Kodiak Island exploring the island hiking, tide-pooling, history, or taking boat tours from there and staying at a local hotel. The Kodiak Wildlife Refuge.  Gray Whales seasonally feeding right offshore of 'Surfer's Beach, and there is the scenic adjacent 'Fossil Beach as well, beautiful interior mountains where you might have a chance to see bear early morning or late evening when a salmon run is not engaging bear at visible river sites. Wonderful rain forest interiors and ocean vistas (bring your binoculars). Birds and hiking trails.
Name: Katmai National Park

Description: At the edge of the Kenai Peninsula lies a land where the ice age lingers. Nearly 40 glaciers flow from the Harding Icefield, Kenai Fjords' crowning feature. Wildlife thrives in icy waters and lush forests around this vast expanse of ice. Sugpiaq people relied on these resources to nurture a life entwined with the sea.  3.5 hours by train from Anchorage(great scenic train ride- includes a glacier).  In Seward, Stay in Harborside hotel with pool or Best Western hotel by the Marine Mammal Center. Town is almost walkable with shuttles around town and to Exit Glacier. Kinda like a little Lahaina with glaciers.  There are many glaciers here to hike around or on, and go on a boat tour to see tidewater glaciers. There are tons of Marine mammals including orca, humpbacks, otters, sea lions, etc. There is a Marine Center with a great display. Many day boat tours to view the park.
Name: Kenai National Park

Description: Poipu Beach in front has gentle waves and and clear water -- perfect for snorkeling or learning to surf.  Hyatt: top hotel with amazing pool, Kiahuna Plantation Resort OR Castle Kiahuna Plantation Beach Bungalows: Outrigger -cheaper, good pool with one water slide. The condos are large, if not luxe (no AC, unpredictable decor). Some say there is a pool, though small, has a waterslide and kiddie area. Others say no pool. Condos are spread out over grassy area.
Name: Poipu (South point of island)

Description: Beautiful resort area with views and walking trails. Near Hanalei town - good spot.  Westin: top hotel with amazing pool - suites all have washers and dryers as well as kitchens with dishwashers, stovetops, and microwaves. The resort's four pools include a kids' pool. The beach, however, is a 10-minute walk down a steep path.
Name: Princeville (North point of island)

Description: Close to the airport. Narrow beach, not sure about the snorkeling, may be ok.  Waipouli Beach Resort - Outrigger: nice with good pool and waterslides
Name: Kaapa (East side of island)
Glacier National park on our own (not Road Scholar)

Description: A lovely remote beach, accessible by water taxi.  It has a small fishing village and some palapa (thatched-roof) restaurants offering fresh seafood.
Name: Playa de las Ánimas

Description: This beach, just beyond Las Ánimas, has a waterfall accessible by half-hour hike or by hiring a pony on the beach to take you up.
Name: Playa de Quimixto

Description: Head for the tropical highlands of the Sierra Madre mountains and wander the well-curated Jardín Botánico de Vallarta (Vallarta Botanical Gardens), home to one of Mexico's most extensive orchid collections and a fascinating variety of native plants and birds.  Stroll through wooded grounds colored with bromeliads, succulents and brilliant hummingbirds, make your way down a jungle trail to the tranquil shores of Río Horcones, where you can cap off the visit with a refreshing dip in a boulder-strewn river.
Name: Jardín Botánico de Vallarta (Vallarta Botanical Gardens)

Description: This tiny museum near the western end of Isla Cuale has a small collection of beautiful pottery, grinding stones, clay figurines and other ancient objects.
Name: Museo del Cuale

Description: Prime catches are sailfish, marlin, tunas ,red snapper and sea bass.
Name: Fishing charter

Description: Snorkeling tour to the Marietas Islands, visiting the hidden beach. You also see dolphins, turtles, manta rays, and whales, while underwater you can check out a colorful array of tropical fish.
Name: Snorkeling Charter

Description: A vast ranch 90 minutes south of Puerto Vallarta offers a slew of fun activities including horseback excursions to local petroglphs, swimming in a gorgeous river and tour of  the distillery where they produce knock-your-socks-off Caicilla (a tequila-like distillation of wild agave).  The on site restaurant serves delicious meals including steaks, Mexican standards and fabulous mole pablano.
Name: Hacienda El Divisadero

Description: A reproduction Spanish galleon that does pirate--themed daytime cruises from 9am to 4 pm
Name: Marigalante pirate ship

Description: Offers 10 waterslides, a lazy river swimming pool, daily dolphin shows and opportunities to play with dolphins and sea lions.
Name: Aquaventuras Park

Description: ChocoMuseo chocolate factory will tell you everything you ever wanted to know about Mexican cacao and chocolate. We offer workshops where you will learn how to make chocolate from Bean to Bar or truffles with ganache.
Name: ChocoMuseo

Description: A charming antidote to the hustle and bustle of nearby Puerto Vallarta. You’ll meet the friendly locals and enjoy beautiful beaches, fantastic dining, outdoor activities and art galleries. Locals congregate in the small plaza in the center of town or head for the beach for some sun and unfettered mountain and bay views. Beyond the beaches of Bucerias, you’ll find superb dining, flea markets laden with special treasures, art galleries, and pubs. Once you’ve tired of the sun, meander through the flea market off the main plaza and tour the residential side of Bucerias, complete with boutique shopping and quality restaurants like La Quinta di Francesco and Adriatico. Some of the best art galleries in town include Splurge Art Gallery, showcasing emerging local artists and designer pewter. On Thursday evenings, participate in the local art walk, and on Sundays, visit the authentic Mexican market.
Name: Bucerias

Description: Villa La Estancia Beach Resort & Spa, Los Cabos. Known for its refined elegance, sophisticated style and relaxing atmosphere right on Médano Beach, this resort creates an experience to relish. The pampering begins the moment you enter the lobby of the luxurious Villa La Estancia. Located on Médano Beach, this five-star retreat prides itself on offering magnificence amidst a relaxed setting. Free parking, Free internet, Pool, Fitness Center with Gym, Bar, Beach, Snorkeling, Babysitting
Name: A day at the hotel pool and beach

Description: Villa La Estancia Beach Resort & Spa, Los Cabos. Known for its refined elegance, sophisticated style and relaxing atmosphere right on Médano Beach, this resort creates an experience to relish. The pampering begins the moment you enter the lobby of the luxurious Villa La Estancia. Located on Médano Beach, this five-star retreat prides itself on offering magnificence amidst a relaxed setting. Free parking, Free internet, Pool, Fitness Center with Gym, Bar, Beach, Snorkeling, Babysitting
Name: A second day at the hotel pool and beach

Description: Villa La Estancia Beach Resort & Spa, Los Cabos. Known for its refined elegance, sophisticated style and relaxing atmosphere right on Médano Beach, this resort creates an experience to relish. The pampering begins the moment you enter the lobby of the luxurious Villa La Estancia. Located on Médano Beach, this five-star retreat prides itself on offering magnificence amidst a relaxed setting. Free parking, Free internet, Pool, Fitness Center with Gym, Bar, Beach, Snorkeling, Babysitting
Name: A third day at the hotel pool and beach

Description: Villa La Estancia Beach Resort & Spa, Los Cabos. Known for its refined elegance, sophisticated style and relaxing atmosphere right on Médano Beach, this resort creates an experience to relish. The pampering begins the moment you enter the lobby of the luxurious Villa La Estancia. Located on Médano Beach, this five-star retreat prides itself on offering magnificence amidst a relaxed setting. Free parking, Free internet, Pool, Fitness Center with Gym, Bar, Beach, Snorkeling, Babysitting
Name: A fourth day at the hotel pool and beach

Description: Casual atmosphere with eclectic and bohemian artwork.  The food is serious and features old recipes and uncommon indigenous sauces
Name: Red Cabbage Cafe

Description: You could easily miss this hole-in-the-wall bakery, but don't!  The flamboyant French owner bakes fabulous sweet and savory goodies, including eclairs, fruit tarts, quiches and chocolate-almond croissants.
Name: Paris Cafe

Description: Drawing a regular nighttime crowd, this taqueria servers delicious tacos al pastor until the wee hours.
Name: Pancho's Takos

Description: Many consider this to be Ballarta's finest restaurant.  You're sure to enjoy this romantic ambiance and exquisite fusion of French and Mexican influences.  The service is formal but unobtrusive, and reservations are recommended.
Name: Cafe des Artistes

Description: Owner Carmen Porras takes special pleasure in rescuing old family recipes from obscurity, with an emphasis on fresh local ingredients.  Specialties include crispy duck carnitas with orange sauce, and rib-eye steak marinated in Mexican spices and tequila.  The restaurant, with its open kitchen and romantic courtyard, also serves as a venue for monthly cooking classes.
Name: El Arrayan Cosina Tradicional

Description: This bright and cheerful family-run place with upstairs seating and tree-shaded back patio has been serving dependably tasty Mexican classics; it is best at lunchtime when the daily pix-fixe menu including main dish, soup, and agua fresca cost only M$59.
Name: Gaby's'

Description: Revisit our favorite parts of the Big Island.
Name: Big Island (Hawaii)

Description: Revisit our favorite parts of the Redwood National Park.
Name: North Coast Redwoods

Description: 7-Day Canada & New England Discovery.
Name: New England Cruise

Description: 7-Day Baja Peninsula & Sea Of Cortez (winter and spring dates, may not work out).
Name: Mexico Cruise

Description: 7-Day Glacier Discovery Northbound, Vancouver to Whittier AK or 7-Day Alaska Inside Passage.
Name: Alaska Cruise

Description: Victoria & surrounding Vancouver Island.
Name: Victoria (West Canada)

Description: Baffin Island & Auyuittuq National Park.
Name: Baffin Island (North Canada)

Description: Banff National Park and Lake Louise located in Alberta's Rocky Mountains, North of Montana
Name: Banff National Park and Lake Louise.

Description: Rotterdam, Invergordon, IsaFjordur, AkureyriseydisFjordur, Reykjavik
Name: Fjords of Iceland (One-way)

Description: Reykjavik, Heimaeg, Djupivogur, Aberdeen, Edinburgh, Rotterdam
Name: Viking Trails and Celtic Origins (One-way)

Description: Rotterdam, Bergen, Olden, Eidfjord, Nordfjord, Rotterdam
Name: Norwegian Fjords & Nordfjord (Round Trip)

Description: Rotterdam, Kristiansand, Oslo, Sandnes, Skjolden Holla, Rotterdam
Name: Norwegian Fjords & Nordford (Round Trip)

Description: Visit the windmills of Kinderdijk - 19 beautifully preserved 18th-century windmills, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Walk past the windmills and tour inside one to see how these ingenious machines harness wind power. Great photo opportunities of the countryside. 3.75 hours.
Name: Windmills of Kinderdijk

Description: Comprehensive 7-hour tour featuring Vigeland Sculpture Park with 200+ sculptures, Holmenkollen Ski Jump with fantastic Oslo views, buffet lunch, National Museum of Norwegian Maritime History, and Open-Air Folk Museum with 150 authentic buildings including 13th-century Gol Stave Church.
Name: Best of Oslo with Lunch

Description: 3-hour bike tour through Oslo on car-free paths, parks and hidden streets. See the medieval castle, Royal Palace, and Frogner Sculpture Park. Fun and relaxed way to discover major sights with plenty of stops for photos. Moderate activity level.
Name: Biking in Oslo

Description: Walking tour unveiling Oslo's famous sites including City Hall (where Nobel Peace Prize is held), Akershus Fortress (1299), Royal Palace, and Opera House. Charming mix of timber houses, neo-Classical buildings and modern architecture. 3 hours of walking.
Name: Explore Oslo on Foot

Description: History Channel curated tour exploring Norway's maritime legacy. Visit three fascinating museums: Norwegian Maritime Museum, Kon-Tiki Museum (Thor Heyerdahl expeditions), and Fram Museum (world's most famous polar ship from 1892). Self-guided museum exploration. 5 hours.
Name: Norway's Great Explorers

Description: 4-hour tour combining panoramic city drive and electric boat cruise on inner Oslofjord. See Opera House, Royal Palace, and Akershus Fortress from land, then explore spectacular shoreline between islands with app-led audio guide. Café available on boat.
Name: Oslo by Land & Sea

Description: 45-minute drive to picturesque Drøbak, the narrowest point of Oslofjord. This charming 1700s town features tiny wooden houses, narrow streets, and Norway's only year-round Christmas shop. 90 minutes free time, then visit Vigeland Sculpture Park. 4.5 hours.
Name: Vigeland Park & Drøbak

Description: 3-hour walking tour of charming Kristiansand, Norway's fifth-largest city. See areas spanning 370+ years of history, from the Gothic cathedral (1880s) and fortress (1670s) to the modern Kilden Performing Arts Center (2012). Visit fish market and Sørlandets Art Museum. 2.5 miles walking.
Name: Walk Through Historical Kristiansand

Description: Immerse in Norway's natural beauty with a 2-mile hike through Baneheia and Ravnedalen parks. Developed by General Wergeland in late 19th century, these areas feature winding paths, lookout points, and thriving flora/fauna. Snack of chocolate bar, flatbread, fruit and juice included. 3.5 hours.
Name: City & Nature Walk

Description: 2-hour motorized boat cruise through Kristiansand's Randesund Archipelago (988 islands, islets and reefs). See whitewashed weekend properties, coastal dwellings, and Crown Prince Håkon's summer residence on Dvergsøya Island. Calm waters and warm, friendly landscape.
Name: Cruising the Archipelago

Description: 4-hour adventure combining boat trip along island-speckled coast and visit to Lillesand, the region's most beautiful town. Features white-painted 18th/19th-century timber houses with sheltered harbor. Free time to explore this 'Jewel of Sorlandet' before scenic coastal road return.
Name: Lillesand: Jewel of Sorlandet

Description: 5-hour drive to Norway's oldest lighthouse, Lindesnes (built 1655), on the southernmost tip of mainland Norway. Tour the National Lighthouse Museum, climb to top for fantastic coastal views, enjoy home-baked muffin with coffee/tea. Dramatic landscape where weather and nature converge.
Name: Norway's Southernmost Lighthouse

Description: Thrilling 5.5-hour white water rafting on the Otra River through Setesdal Valley. Features Class III and IV rapids ideal for novice and experienced rafters. Each raft holds 5-8 guests plus guide. Includes wetsuit, windproof jacket, helmet and life vest. Must be able to swim.
Name: River Rafting Adventure

Description: 3-hour vintage railway journey recreating turn-of-century rail travel. Board narrow-gauge Setesdal Vintage Railway (founded 1896) with restored 1894 locomotive. Snake through wild countryside paralleling Otra River, showcasing lakes, hills and farms. From Grovane to Røyknes.
Name: Setesdal Vintage Railway

Description: Scenic boat cruise to Helgøy Island, home to one of Norway's most beautiful and historic apple farms. Wander lush orchards with fragrant blossoms and ripe fruit, learn generations of apple-growing tradition, taste locally harvested apples, cider and homemade delicacies. Experience Norwegian hospitality. 3 hours.
Name: Helgøy Island Fruit Farm Cruise

Description: 3-hour panoramic drive from city center across bridge to nearby islands. Pass Breiavannet lake, Stavanger Cathedral (1125), Iron-Age Farm at Ullandhaug, Jaeren's sandy beaches, and Sola Church ruins (12th century). Photo stop at Hafrsfjord where Vikings fought historic battle 1000 years ago.
Name: Easy Stavanger

Description: Immersive foodie tour savoring authentic Norwegian tastes in Sandnes. Visit Sirkus Renaa Café (owned by three-Michelin-star family) for finest croissants, breads and tindvedosteterte. Stop at local chocolate factory. Experience local food scene with guide determining day's tastes. 3 hours, ends in town.
Name: Foodie Flavors of Sandnes

Description: 4-hour high-speed RIB adventure through Stavanger Archipelago to spectacular Lysefjord. See vacation homes, remote spots, and immensely famous Pulpit Rock dominating the fjord. Entertaining commentary from RIB captain with wildlife viewing opportunities. Survival suits provided. Bumpy ride.
Name: Lysefjord Pulpit Rock by RIB

Description: 3-hour boat cruise through Stavanger Archipelago with guide pointing out attractions. Cruise to splendid Lysefjord to see Pulpit Rock promontory jutting 1,500+ feet above sea. Stop en route for coffee and waffles served Norwegian-style with sour cream and jam. Water as deep as mountains are high.
Name: Lysefjord Pulpit Rock Cruise

Description: History Channel partnership journey through centuries of Norwegian history. See Swords in Rock Monument (30+ feet, commemorating 872 AD Battle of Hafrsfjord), Viking House VR experience, ancient Doomstones stone circle, Iron Age farm, Petroleum Museum, and stroll through Old Stavanger's wooden houses. 4.5 hours.
Name: Stavanger Old & New (History Channel)

Description: 4-hour tour visiting Stavanger Maritime Museum (millennium-long relationship with sea) and Norwegian Petroleum Museum (offshore operations as Norway's most important industry). Learn cultural, economic and social effects of oil industry. Walk through city center between museums.
Name: Stavanger's Maritime Culture

Description: Chronological food journey at Fjordstova in Skjolden's center, tasting Norwegian specialties from Viking roots to present day. Try rømmegraut (like oatmeal), brunost (brown cheese), and fresh seasonal samples. Learn about region through guide commentary and audiovisual presentation. Fjord and mountain views. 2 hours.
Name: Culinary Viking to Today

Description: Comprehensive 7-hour tour through Jotunheimen National Park (1,351 sq miles). See ice-blue Lake Fantesteinsvatnet, Hurrungane mountains (27 of Norway's highest peaks), stop at 4,700-ft Sognefjell Mountain Pass. Visit Lom's magnificent stave church (AD 1158), Norwegian Mountain Museum with mammoth model, and Åsafossen Waterfall. Lunch included.
Name: Best of Skjolden

Description: 4-hour panoramic drive along Sognefjord through Jostedal Valley with traditional agriculture. See Jostedal Glacier (largest ice field in mainland Norway, remnant from 18,000 years ago). Visit Breheim Glacier Center with exhibits, shop, café and distant view of Nigardsbreen Glacier.
Name: Jostedal Glacier National Park

Description: Scenic 4-hour drive designed for minimal walking but maximum photo opportunities. Travel Sognefjellet National Tourist Road to 4,700-ft elevation (Northern Europe's highest pass). See ancient stone pyramids (varde), hairpin curves past Fortun village, and 24 colossal Jotunheimen peaks over 6,560 ft. Norwegian waffles at mountain lodge.
Name: Jotunheimen & Sognefjell Pass

Description: Family-friendly 2-hour kayak safari through tranquil emerald waters of Lustrafjord. Paddle beneath towering mountains, past cascading waterfalls, encounter seals, porpoises and seabirds. Breathtaking views of Molden peak. Learn about Skjolden's Viking roots. No prior experience needed, must know how to swim.
Name: Kayak Hidden Wonders

Description: 3.5-hour bike & hike adventure through Breheimen National Park's peaceful Mørkid Valley. 4.3 miles (1 hour) cycling learning culture and history, then 30-minute hike on rocky trail to dramatic Drivande Waterfall. Snack of flatbread and cured meats. Total ascent 1,050 feet. Minimum age 8.
Name: Mørkid Valley Bike & Hike

Description: Exhilarating 1.75-hour RIB ride through magnificent Lustrafjord. Speed past small fjord farms from 100 years ago, see Feigumfossen Waterfall cascading 656 feet. Short stops for guide commentary about natural landscape and local history. Locally-produced fruit juice included. Survival suits provided.
Name: RIB Adventure

Description: 3.5-hour tour visiting Norway's oldest and most decorated stave church - Urnes (built 1130), perched on Lustrafjord shores. Only Norwegian stave church recognized as UNESCO World Heritage Site. Also visit Ornes Shipyard (1975) learning Viking-era woodcrafting techniques. Return via narrow, winding Romantic Road.
Name: Urnes Stave Church & Shipyard

Description: 3-hour walking experience with lovable llamas on Simon Page's farm in Mørkid Valley. Walk across old footbridge over Fortun River to farm growing raspberries with old Norse sheep breed. Team up with a llama for leisurely riverbank walk. Hot/cold beverage and cookies. 2.5 hours total walking.
Name: Walking with Llamas
Baarle-Nassau border enclaves                   Tourist info @ Center Singel 1
Description: Train: From Rotterdam to Breda (Centraal Station); Bus: 375 (132) every 30 min to Baarle-Nassau; Stops Baarle-Nassau, St. Jan Straat;

Name: Delfshaven Oude of Pelgrimvaderskerk (Pilgrim Fathers Church)  Aelbrechtskolk 22
Description: The Pilgrims prayed for the last time at this church (1417) bf leaving for America aboard the Speedwell 8/1/1620, transferred to Mayflower in England; take tram line 4 to Marconiplein from Centraal, off at Delfshaven

Name: Rotterdam Architecture
Description: vertical city, largest building, forest of cube houses, pencil shaped building, horseshoe shaped covered market, ethereal cloud-like bld National History Museum

Name: Rotterdam Harbor
Description: one of bases for Dutch East India Company; canals constructed in 1800s; bombed by germans in WWII

Name: Rotterdam Markthal Rotterdam (food market)
Description: inverted u-shaped market hall

Name: Rotterdam Maritiem Museum Rotterdam
Description: also includes entry to historic vessels and cranes moored in the Leuvehaven to 4 pm

Name: Rotterdam, Museum Boijmans van Beuningen
Description: fine arts; Rubens, Rembrandt, Monet, Degas, Van Gogh, Picasso, Miró, Bacon

Name: Rotterdam Euromast
Description: 185 M high, 360° views, rotating glass elevator / water taxi: watertaxirotterdam.nl

Name: Rotterdam Pleinbloscoop Rotterdam, Museumpark
Description: film festival

Name: Rotterdam Whisper Boat
Description: tours of canals - depart from historic fishmarket (Vismarkt)

Name: Rotterdam Kinderdjik                                        fast ferry 202 from Rotterdam Erasmusbrug
Description: empty marshes and waterways with 19 historic windmills; 2 museums, visitor center; take boat Waterbus

Name: Rotterdam Centraal Station to Amsterdam
Description: train; bikes have right of way; bring cash; check return tax for 50 Euros per day = belastingdienst.nl; 10% tips; coffeehouse = pot/cafe = food, no smoke

Name: Amsterdam South - Van Gogh Museum
Description: Get tix online - strict 30 min. time slots / Open to 9 pm F Sa ??? / then Canals, cheese shops / etix; less crowds late afternoon after 3 pm, go Su-R

Name: Amsterdam South - Rijks Museum
Description: Get tix online / Open to 10 pm / then park; less crowds before 10 am & after 3 pm, go Su-R; line to get in / floor 1 & 2 best, floor 0 Asian collection Museumplein has skatepark

Name: Amsterdam South - Vondelpark
Description: ponds, rose garden, Picasso The Fish sculpture; bikes good; play at open air theater; restaurants at western edge: Amstelveenseweg (1865)

Name: Amsterdam South - Riekermolen             westbank of Amstel river, south of Amstel park
Description: Windmill (1636) sketched by Rembrandt, see statue

Name: Amsterdam - Southern Canal Ring
Description: cruises; stroll Grand Golden Bend-nice houses; Pastry: Patisserie Holtkamp, order croquettes (kroketten)

Name: Amsterdam - Southern Canal Ring Reguliersgracht
Description: Canal: (canal of 7 bridges), best on boat; at night lit up

Name: Amsterdam - Southern Canal Ring Magere Brug    btwn Kerkstraat & Nieuwe Kerkstraat
Description: Bridge on Amstel (1670) Nine arched “Skinny Bridge”; hand operated section to let boats through; at night, 1200 tiny lights; feel it sway; Nearby Amstel Locks (Amstelsluizen)

Name: Amsterdam - Southern Canal Ring Bloemenmarkt
Description: bulbs; floating flower market, now on pilings; bulbs year round (1860)

Name: Amsterdam - Southern Canal Ring Blauwbrug           btwn Waterlooplein & Amstelstraat
Description: Bridge on Amstel (1884) highly decorated stone bridge - fish sculptures & ornate street lamps

Name: Canals/Locks
Description: water flushes in from IJsselmeer, out to sea at Amstelsluizen (1674) sluices on Amstel river near Koninklijk Theatre Carre; Tours depart from Centraal Station, Damrak, Rokin, & opposite Rijksmuseum (canal bus). Look for open seating area boat. At night lights but more $. Those Dam Boat Guys (Jordaan), Canal Bus (hop on/off), Blue Boat Company

Name: Amsterdam De Pijp - Albert Cuypmarkt
Description: largest street bazaar; every day except Sun; brunch Bakers & Roasters

Name: Amsterdam - Western Canal Ring Canals
Description: Oldest Bridge on Singel - Torensluis (1648);

Name: Amsterdam - Western Canal Ring
Description: Prinsengracht: Nice area; lunch: Bistro Bj ons;

Name: Amsterdam - Western Canal Ring Het Grachtenhuis
Description: Canal Museum, how it was built, model of Amsterdam (takes 45 min)

Name: Amsterdam - Jordaan Pianola Museum
Description: jazz and classical tunes on pianolas (1900s), tours, 12 on display, music rolls and player pipe organ

Name: Amsterdam - Jordaan Houseboat Museum
Description: 23 M sailing barge (1914); cash only

Name: Amsterdam - Jordaan Tulip Museum
Description: history, bulbs, vases, techniques

Name: Amsterdam - Jordaan Noordermarkt
Description: Market: since the 1600s; antiques and organic fare; Sat includes farmer’s market

Name: Amsterdam - Jordaan Het Oud-Hollandsch Snoepwinkeltje
Description: Tues- Sat liquorice zoete(sweet) or zoute (salty)

Name: Amsterdam - Nieuwmarkt, Plantage, Eastern Islands Het Scheepvaartmuseum
Description: maritime, ancient globes, ship figureheads, replica 700 tonne Amsterdam Dutch East India Company fleet schooner to climb in; Royal barge in boathouse; 17th century waterfront bld; Golden Age maps;

Name: Amsterdam Nieuwmarkt, Plantage, Eastern Islands - Hortus Botanicus
Description: botanical gardens (1638) plants from Dutch Trading Ships; butterfly gardens

Name: Amsterdam Nieuwmarkt, Plantage, Eastern Islands - Narrow house                                     Oude Hoogstraat 22
Description: 2.02 M wide, 5 M deep house

Name: Amsterdam - Nieuwmarkt, Plantage, Eastern Islands Museum het Rembranthuis
Description: CLOSED??? / Rembrants’ studio

Name: Amsterdam - Nieuwmarkt, Plantage, Eastern Islands Waterlooplein
Description: Flea Market, porcelain teapots, etc

Name: Amsterdam Old Center/Medieval Ctr/Red Light - Medieval Center
Description: Begijnhof Church (1671)- open door to secret courtyard & gardens tiny houses / Houten Huys (1465) oldest wooden house / Spui Square cobblestone (SPOW) filled in 1882

Name: Amsterdam Old Center - Dam Square
Description: Amsterdam founded in 1270 here; 900 yrs of commerce: Royal Palace (1665) (Koninklijk Paleis); Nieuwe Kerk, & Natl Monument

Name: Amsterdam - Rokin Metro Station
Description: Amsterdam Noord & World Trade Centre Noord/Zuidlijn (north/south) metro line, 134,000 archeological finds, 9,500 on display from 2400 BC

Name: Amsterdam  Oosterpark & East  of the Amstel Muiden Castle
Description: (1280) outside Amsterdam, 13th century castle with moat, drawbridge, and activities for kids; train from Central or ferry from IJburg; red brick castle; lock on IJsselmeer;

Name: DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam - NDSM Wharf, Plein 28
Description: ferry to Amsterdam Centraal train station, waterfront

Name: Netherlands - Hoge Veluwe National Park, Kroller-Muller Museum
Description: Excellent are collection of Van Goghs and sculpture garden; Free bikes; forests, sand dunes, marshes, ponds

Name: Gouda Cheese Market
Description: Check cheese markets on main squares Thursdays Kaasstad & weighing house 10 am - 12:30 pm

Name: Gouda Sint Janskerk
Description: Largest cache of in-situ 16th century stained glass in the world; canal ringed historic center 5 minutes walk from train station

Name: Gouda Kamphulsen Siroopwafels
Description: Strop waffle production line - Local creation

Name: Alkmaar Kaasmarkt
Description: Fri am/ Centuries old cheese market -

Name: Alkmaar Hollands Kaassmusum
Description: (Dutch Cheese Museum)in Waaggebouw built as chapel in 14th centruy, weighing house/ note mechanical tower carillon with jousting knights

Name: Alkmaar Grote Kerk
Description: organs, “Little Swallow Organ” (1511) played noon when church is open

Name: Medemblik Stoommachine Museum       Oosterdijk 4
Description: Steam engine museum Museum Stoomtrain departs from old train station for Hoorn Check schedule for running engines

Name: Edam Kaasmarkt
Description: Cheese market, smaller than Alkmaar / cobblestone streets, hand-operated draw bridges, canals

Name: Edam Fluisterbootjes tourist office
Description: rent boats; Whisper Boats; small electric boat thru canals, up to 7 people

Name: Edam Edams Museum
Description: oldest building with artifacts built 1540, floating cellar that rises and falls with river; Tall girl 9’ 3”

Name: Edam Gestam
Description: sample 30 cheeses; Sat

Name: Delft - Markt
Description: (from Rotterdam -lockers at train station??) one of largest in Europe: R Market; town founded 1100; china from 17th century; canals, museums, cafes; beauty of the Golden Age; Visitor office for map

Name: Delft - pottery
Description: Royal Delft, De Deltse Pauw, De Candelaer, De Blauwe Tulp; can see them painting china

Name: Haarlem - Grote Kerk van St Bavo                  Oude Groenmarkt 22
Description: 50 M Steeple; Muller organ, one of biggest, 30 M high, 5000 pipes (1738); played by Mozart & Handel. Plays occasionally Sun 2:30 or R 4:00 / Check Schedule
